body.p: In general, use the latest available stable (non-alpha) version of Erlang.
The minimum version of Erlang required to run the RabbitMQ server is R12B-3. Certain RabbitMQ configurations require more recent versions:

tr.td: Also needs the Erlang development and runtime tools
Some plugins depend on mochiweb, e.g. the management plugin
Earlier versions do not recognise memory limits.
Earlier versions do not support SSL well.

body.p: If using clustered nodes, all nodes should use the same version of Erlang.

Most current distributions now package Erlang that supports all the above. You can check these specific distributions:
OpenSUSE
Fedora
Macports
Debian
Ubuntu
Fedora EPEL 5 SRPMS
See the RPM-based Linux Installation page for how to install Erlang on RPM-based distributions.

If a sufficiently recent Erlang package is not available for your system then you will need to build Erlang from source. This requires a build environment that satisfies the Erlang build dependencies, such as OpenSSL.
